result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:50 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matias Martin Montemayor Jr appeared by video, in custody at Sheboygan County Jail.  Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Matias Martin Montemayor Jr. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-30-22 at 1:30 p.m.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matias Martin Montemayor Jr not in court, Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Matias Martin Montemayor Jr.   Attorney McQueen just discovered that the defendant is in the Sheboygan County Jail.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Dominique McQueen through Public Defender
Victim Identification Key.
Re:   Attempted battery to law enforcement officer, repeater, on 02-09-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of criminal damage to property, attempted battery to law enforcement officer, resist officer and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with Harbortown Inn, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 02-11-2022
